info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 04 at 4:54PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF CHARLESTON AND BERKELEY COUNTIES... At 453 PM EDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm over Don Holt Bridge, or over I-26/I-526 Interchange, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...up to penny sized hail. SOURCE...Radar Indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to plants, trees and crops is possible. Damage to windshields is unlikely. Some locations in the path of this storm include... North Charleston, Goose Creek, Hanahan, I-26/I-526 Interchange, Daniel Island and Don Holt Bridge. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...<45 MPH
info.instruction: Report damage directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 888-383-2024 when it is safe to do so. You can also email your report to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.
